body:
$! You must tell DVLA if you have sleep apnoea. $!

% You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted. %

##Car or motorcycle licence

Fill in form SL1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D [Download ‘SL1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 189KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_066653.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"} $D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence

Fill in form SL1V and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D [Download ‘SL1V - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 240KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_173966.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"} $D

##Driving while tired

For further information on the dangers of driving while tired, download the leaflet 'Tiredness can kill'.

$D
[Download 'Tiredness can kill' (PDF, 281KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065252.pdf "Download 'Tiredness can kill' (PDF, 281KB)"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA if you have sleep apnoea - download the correct form to let them know
title: Sleep apnoea and driving
